episode.description: Reporter from Indonesia visits Tashiro Island, known as "Cat Island". When the island was struck by the Great East Japan Earthquake, the cats were helping residents collect funds for reconstruction.
episode.subtitle: The Guardian Cats
episode.title: Fresh Eyes on Japan

episode.description: In this episode a Vietnamese reporter experiences the unique cafe culture of Nagoya, a city known for its laid back yet diverse coffee shops, where guests enjoy a unique blend of communication.
episode.subtitle: A Cup of Communication
episode.title: Fresh Eyes on Japan

episode.description: Model Maya Kazi introduces Kanda Jimbocho, a town of old books and curry, and seeks her roots to the Japanese and Bangladeshi culture as she visits the many stores of this double-sided town.
episode.subtitle: Books, Curry and the Taste of Home
episode.title: Fresh Eyes on Japan

episode.description: Batlet Milanzi introduces Oki-gusuri, a unique medicine system of Japan where people "use now, pay later." In order to dig deeper into the folklore and the birthplace of Oki-gusuri, she visits Toyama.
episode.subtitle: From Toyama to Tanzania: Oki-gusuri Medicine Peddlers Cross the World
episode.title: Fresh Eyes on Japan

episode.description: Russian reporter Anastasia Monakova found a similarity between the Japanese story of a faithful dog "Hachi" and a story in Russia. She visits Odate in Akita, the hometown of Hachi and meets a breeder.
episode.subtitle: Faithful Dogs, True Friends
episode.title: Fresh Eyes on Japan
